able to be considered in a court of law: The judge ruled that this new evidence was admissible.

allowed or able to be considered in a court of law: The board's findings would be admissible in criminal court. It remains to be seen whether the report produces any admissible evidence. admissibility noun [ U ]
There is some dispute about the admissibility of children's evidence.
